intro: Prenanthes callosa, commonly known as the roughleaf waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its unique inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a spathe. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped with a rough, hairy texture, and it produces small, white flowers that bloom in late summer. Prenanthes callosa is often found in wetlands and is an important plant for local ecosystems.
